definition: to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident

pinyin: zhuang4 ji1 shi4 yin4 biao3 ji1
zhuang4 ji1 shi4 da3 yin4 ji1

sentences.english: Naval experts said they were amazed by the collision.
sentences.chinese: 海事專家說他們對這次撞擊很驚訝。

sentences.english: Fortunately, Ijurmped back in time to avoid being hit.
sentences.chinese: 很僥倖，我及時往後跳以免費遭撞擊。

sentences.english: He is hitting the wire leader with his spear, he thought.
sentences.chinese: 它正用它的長嘴撞擊着鐵絲導線，他想。

sentences.english: He chopped down the beanstalk and the giant came crashing down with a tremendous thud.
sentences.chinese: 巨人隨着巨大的撞擊聲摔了下來。

sentences.english: Are these indications of a fragment of the Tunguska body?
sentences.chinese: 這些現象是否代表那裏埋著通古斯卡撞擊天體的碎片？

sentences.english: He knew only one thing could slam him with such force.
sentences.chinese: 他知道只有一種東西能用這麼大的力量撞擊他。

sentences.english: It often happens that the jetty of a wharf is struck by a ship.
sentences.chinese: 碼頭引橋受船舶撞擊的事故屢有發生。

sentences.english: A running track should be capable of absorbing the impact of a runner's foot landing on it.
sentences.chinese: 跑道應該能夠吸收奔跑者踩踏地面時產生的撞擊力。

sentences.english: My back is hitting the round post jamb unceasingly.
sentences.chinese: 我的背脊不斷地撞擊着圓柱壁。

sentences.english: Oyola was back on 81 when the second plane arrived.
sentences.chinese: 阿約拉剛回到81層，第二次撞擊就發生了。

sentences.english: Tyson had repeatedly complained about head-butting in the first bout between the two.
sentences.chinese: 第一回閤中，泰森在不斷抱怨兩人之間的頭部撞擊。

sentences.english: Down the side of the mountain tumbled a foaming waterfall.
sentences.chinese: 在山的一側還有瀑布翻騰而下，撞擊出白色的水沫。

sentences.english: The plastic hardening of the heel of blades is enhanced with the impacting location closer to the top of blades.
sentences.chinese: 撞擊位置越接近葉片尖部，葉根處的塑性硬化越強。

sentences.english: When the dreams crush to reality, it smashed. That's always made a sound of misery.
sentences.chinese: 當夢想遭到現實的撞擊時，總會發出悽美的破碎聲。

sentences.english: As this plane was hit by electrical frequencies, the vibration of disharmony resulted.
sentences.chinese: 當此層面被電性頻率撞擊，不調和的振動發生。

definition: to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
variant of 衝擊|冲击[chong1 ji1]
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
